byline.contributor: Joseph Goldstein reported from Kabul, and Eric Schmitt from Washington.
byline.original: By JOSEPH GOLDSTEIN and ERIC SCHMITT

abstract: Defense Department officials say American airstrike that destroyed Doctors Without Borders hospital in Kunduz, Afghanistan, was result of human error, failures in procedure and technical malfunctions; report is soon to be released.
lead_paragraph: The intended target of an airstrike on a Doctors Without Borders hospital last month was a compound believed to be a Taliban base, military officials briefed on an inquiry said.

headline.main: Human Error Cited in U.S. Strike on Kunduz Hospital
headline.print_headline: Report Cites Human Error in Airstrike on Hospital

snippet: The intended target of an airstrike on a Doctors Without Borders hospital last month was a compound believed to be a Taliban base, military officials briefed on an inquiry said.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
